body_html:
FWIW, I've got a different error building TensorFlow 1.7.0 using Bazel 0.12.0 on Linaro HiKey960:

$ ck install package:lib-tensorflow-1.7.0-src-cpu --env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=2
...
ERROR: /home/anton/.cache/bazel/_bazel_anton/19f8e08691d47ead673afa362fc193f9/external/jpeg/BUILD:269:1: C++ compilation of rule '@jpeg//:simd_armv7a' failed (Exit 1)                                                                                                   
gcc: error: unrecognized command line option '-mfloat-abi=softfp'                                                       
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.                                            
INFO: Elapsed time: 668.059s, Critical Path: 63.27s                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully

Smells like a Bazel 0.12.0 problem separate from the issue reported here.

Update: Reported this Bazel 0.12.0 issue here: bazelbuild/bazel#5080

body:
FWIW, I've got a different error building TensorFlow 1.7.0 using Bazel 0.12.0 on Linaro HiKey960:
```
$ ck install package:lib-tensorflow-1.7.0-src-cpu --env.CK_HOST_CPU_NUMBER_OF_PROCESSORS=2
...
ERROR: /home/anton/.cache/bazel/_bazel_anton/19f8e08691d47ead673afa362fc193f9/external/jpeg/BUILD:269:1: C++ compilation of rule '@jpeg//:simd_armv7a' failed (Exit 1)                                                                                                   
gcc: error: unrecognized command line option '-mfloat-abi=softfp'                                                       
Target //tensorflow/tools/pip_package:build_pip_package failed to build                                                                                                                                                                                                  
Use --verbose_failures to see the command lines of failed build steps.                                            
INFO: Elapsed time: 668.059s, Critical Path: 63.27s                                                                                                                                                                                                                      
FAILED: Build did NOT complete successfully
```
Smells like a Bazel 0.12.0 problem separate from the issue reported here.

**Update:** Reported this Bazel 0.12.0 issue here: https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/5080
